1.name: True Grit
1.description: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.

2.name: Midnight Cowboy
2.description: A naive hustler travels from Texas to New York City to seek personal fortune, finding a new friend in the process.

3.name: Easy Rider
3.description: Through the open country and desert lands, two bikers head from L.A to New Orleans, and along the way, meet a man who bridges a counter-culture gap they are unaware of.

4.name: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
4.description: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

5.name: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
5.description: James Bond woos a mob boss' daughter and goes undercover to uncover the true reason for Ernst Stavro Blofeld's allergy research in the Swiss Alps involving beautiful women from around the world.

6.name: The Wild Bunch
6.description: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.

7.name: The Undefeated
7.description: After the Civil War, ex-Confederate soldiers heading for a new life in Mexico run into ex-Union cavalrymen selling horses to the Mexican government but they must join forces to fight off Mexican bandits and revolutionaries.

8.name: The Italian Job
8.description: Comic caper movie about a plan to steal a gold shipment from the streets of Turin by creating a traffic jam.

9.name: The Reivers
9.description: In turn-of-the-century Mississippi, an 11-year-old boy comes of age as two mischievous adult friends talk him into sneaking the family car out for a trip to Memphis and a series of adventures.

10.name: Last Summer
10.description: During summer vacation on Fire Island, three young people become very close. When an uncool girl tries to infiltrate the trio's newly found relationship, they construct an elaborate plot that has violent results.

11.name: Z
11.description: Following the murder of a prominent leftist, an investigator tries to uncover the truth while government officials attempt to cover up their roles.

12.name: Fellini - Satyricon
12.description: A series of disjointed mythical tales set in first century Rome.

13.name: Hello, Dolly!
13.description: Matchmaker Dolly Levi travels to Yonkers to find a partner for "half-a-millionaire" Horace Vandergelder, convincing his niece, his niece's intended, and his two clerks to travel to New York City along the way.

14.name: Support Your Local Sheriff!
14.description: In the old west, a man becomes a Sheriff just for the pay, figuring he can decamp if things get tough. In the end, he uses ingenuity instead.

15.name: Sweet Charity
15.description: Taxi dancer Charity continues to have Faith despite endless disappointments at its hands, and Hope that she will finally meet the man to romance her away from her sleazy life. Maybe, just maybe, handsome Oscar will be the one to do it.

16.name: Battle of Britain
16.description: In 1940, the British Royal Air Force fights a desperate battle to prevent the Luftwaffe from gaining air superiority over the English Channel as a prelude to a possible Axis invasion of the U.K.

17.name: They Shoot Horses, Don't They?
17.description: The lives of a disparate group of contestants intertwine in an inhumanely grueling dance marathon.

18.name: Paint Your Wagon
18.description: Two unlikely prospector partners share the same wife in a California gold rush mining town.

19.name: La piscine
19.description: Lovers Marianne and Jean-Paul spend their vacation in a villa on the French Riviera near St-Tropez. Marianne invites her former lover, Harry, and his teenage daughter to stay. Tension rises between them, especially when Jean-Paul seduces Penelope.

20.name: The Arrangement
20.description: A suicidal advertising executive is forced to re-evaluate his life while dealing with his unhappy marriage, his mistress, and his aging father.

21.name: Women in Love
21.description: Two best friends fall in love with a pair of women, but the relationships soon go in very different directions.

22.name: Kes
22.description: A young, English working-class boy spends his free time caring for and training his pet falcon.

23.name: Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice
23.description: A light-hearted picture of middle-aged love and friendship.

24.name: The Army of Shadows
24.description: An account of underground resistance fighters in Nazi-occupied France.

25.name: The Bridge at Remagen
25.description: As the Allied armies close in, the Germans decide to blow up the last Rhine bridge, trapping their own men on the wrong side. But will it happen?

26.name: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
26.description: A headstrong young teacher in a private school in 1930s Edinburgh ignores the curriculum and influences her impressionable twelve-year-old charges with her over-romanticized world view.

27.name: The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes
27.description: At Medfield College, an accident with a donated computer gives Dexter Riley the ability to remember any knowledge learned instantly and perfectly.

28.name: Topaz
28.description: A French Intelligence Agent becomes embroiled in the Cold War politics first with uncovering the events leading up to the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis, and then back to France to break up an international Russian spy ring.

29.name: Age of Consent
29.description: A grizzled Australian painter decides to jolt his stale creativity in a remote island on the Great Barrier Reef, where he meets an alluring young islander who becomes his enchanting model. Could the untamed girl be his long-awaited muse?

30.name: The Magic Christian
30.description: Sir Guy Grand (Peter Sellers), the richest man in the world, adopts a homeless boy, Youngman (Sir Ringo Starr). Together, they set out to prove that anyone, and anything, can be bought with money.

31.name: Medium Cool
31.description: A TV news reporter finds himself becoming personally involved in the violence that erupts around the 1968 Democratic National Convention.

32.name: Pippi Långstrump
32.description: Pippi Longstocking, a super-strong redheaded little girl, moves into her father's cottage Villa Villekulla, and has adventures with her next-door neighbors Tommy and Annika in this compilation film of the classic Swedish TV series.

33.name: Sayat Nova
33.description: A super-stylized, surreal biography of Armenian troubadour Sayat Nova, whose life is depicted through non-narrative amalgamations of poetic images.

34.name: Downhill Racer
34.description: Quietly cocky Robert Redford joins U.S. ski team as downhill racer and clashes with the team's coach, played by Gene Hackman. Lots of good skiing action leading to an exciting climax.

35.name: Model Shop
35.description: George Matthews is a young man who is having a bittersweet affair with a French divorcée in Los Angeles. Waiting to be drafted, he is unable to commit himself to anything or anybody, ...                See full summary »

36.name: Mackenna's Gold
36.description: A bandit kidnaps a Marshal who has seen a map showing a gold vein on Indian lands, but other groups are looking for it too, while the Apache try to keep the secret location undisturbed.

37.name: Medea
37.description: After his quest to retrieve the fabled Golden Fleece, Jason returns to Greece with the powerful sorceress, Medea. However, when the king banishes her, it's only human that Medea plots her furious revenge. Can they escape her wrath?

38.name: Cactus Flower
38.description: A dentist pretends to be married to avoid commitment, but when he falls for his girlfriend and proposes, he must recruit his lovelorn nurse to pose as his wife.

39.name: La caduta degli dei (Götterdämmerung)
39.description: The dramatic collapse of a wealthy, industrialist/Junker family during the reign of the Third Reich.

40.name: Zeta One
40.description: A race of sexy women from Angvia, a planet in another dimension, come to earth to kidnap women to repopulate their planet.

41.description: Young philanderer inherits 13 ratty antique chairs and decides to sell them off to get some money. Later he learns that one of them contains jewels worth a lot of money, so he begins an ...                See full summary »

42.name: Anne of the Thousand Days
42.description: King Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Catharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favor of the young and beautiful Anne Boleyn.

43.name: The Gypsy Moths
43.description: Three skydivers and their travelling thrill show barnstorm through a small midwestern town one Fourth of July weekend.

44.name: Spalovac mrtvol
44.description: Set in World War II, a demented cremator believes cremation relieves earthly suffering and sets out to save the world.

45.name: Goodbye, Columbus
45.description: A Jewish man and a Jewish woman meet and while attracted to each other, find that their worlds are very different. She is the archtypical Jewish American Princess, very emotionally involved...                See full summary »

46.name: 100 Rifles
46.description: In 1912 Sonora, Mexico, native revolutionary Yaqui Joe robs a bank to buy arms for his oppressed people, but finds himself sought by an American lawman and the Mexican Army.

47.name: Ma nuit chez Maud
47.description: The rigid principles of a devout Catholic man are challenged during a one-night stay with Maud, a divorced woman with an outsize personality.

48.name: The Illustrated Man
48.description: In 1930s, a psychotic drifter who's after the mystery woman who covered his whole body in illustrations that foresee distant future shows three of them (The Veldt, The Long Rain and The Last Night of the World) to a mesmerized traveler.

49.name: Me, Natalie
49.description: A young woman struggles for independence.

50.name: Bitka na Neretvi
50.description: World war two drama about the 1943 battle around the Neretva River between Axis forces and Yugoslav partisan units.
